comments:
This is hard to repeat bug, because it seems to depend
on how fast you press buttons...
If this error happens, only restarting Eclipse
can help.
Also it seems that it dependent on CVS decoration labels - all
appearance of bug happens when CVS label decorations are ON.

For example _sometimes_ sequense of :
Try next steps:
1. Create new Java Project.
2. Create new Class (named Class1) in the project. - Class1.java is opened.
3. Insert "//comment" between "{" and "}".
4. Right-click and select Save in the Class1.java window. - Next error message 
appears:
"Save could not be completed"
"Widget is disposed"

Excpetion happens:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2119)

The bug happens in error box

Looks like the Navigator got disposed.  Not sure how this could happen with 
this sequence of steps.  Although the Navigator is not shown by default in the 
Java perspective (which is switched to when you create the Java project), it is 
not disposed until the Resource perspective is closed (assuming you started in 
the Resource perspective and no other perspectives have the Navigator open).

Actually, on closer inspection, the view is a 
com.exigen.studio.navigator.NavigatorView, not the Eclipse Navigator.

What do you know about this view?
Bug was in the com.exigen.studio component
